item.title: Report E-2025040144
item.description:
Report E-2025040144

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: EL DORADO
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: B-ANN DISTRIBUTING CO., L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 33000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: B-Ann Driver was dispatched for a power unit only load for Southwest Logistics/ OFS Inc. B-Ann Driver picked up trailer #463 in OKC and picked up a load of Ferric Chloride in Russelville Arkansas and Delivered to Topeka, KS. The driver noticed a tire separating on the trailer, he contacted Southwest Logistics/OFS Inc dispatch for direction on where to go for repairs. Southwest Logistics dispatcher sent B-Ann Driver to Loves truck stop El Dorado KS. Upon arrival B-Ann Driver noticed a leak on the trailer. He contacted Southwest Logistics Dispatcher, who contacted Don Cox. OFS INC/ Southwest Logistics Safety Manager, Don Cox then contacted Boomer Enviriomental to contain and Clean up spill

item.title: Report X-2025040461
item.description:
Report X-2025040461

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-07
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fully loaded trailer arrived to 007 and was on the yard and discovered to be leaking from the nose of the trailer. The spill appears to be paint and is suspected to be from pro 030893354. The cause, package type and capacity, and amount spilled are unknown. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation.~~Called CURA and spoke with Holli who advised a crew would be sent out to clean the yard and determine unknowns.~~Holli with CURA advised that boxes containing gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit causing the release.

  • Description: A LEAKING PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE FLOOR OUTSIDE DOOR 301. A RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA. THE PACKAGE IS BEING HELD AT FACILITY. DAMAGE INSPECTION; NON HAZARDOUS LEAKER; NO LEAK TO BUTANE.

item.title: Report X-2025040432
item.description:
Report X-2025040432

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-01
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOADER NOTICED A LEAKING PACKAGE AND CALLED FOR A RESPONDER. RESPONDER DISCOVERED AMAZON PACKAGE WITH SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID ON ONE CORNER. INSIDE THERE WAS A SECOND BOX AND INADEQUATE AMOUNT OF KRAFT PAPER. INSIDE THE SECOND BOX THERE WAS CORRUGATED SUSPENSION AND A FIRE EXTINGUISHER. THE HEAD OF EXTINGUISER WAS BENT AND THE PIN HAD COME OUT AND FIRE EXTINGUISHER EXPELLED SOME OF ITS CONTENTS.

item.title: Report X-2025040414
item.description:
Report X-2025040414

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-31
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO LEAKING PACKAGE WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. RESPONDER NOTED THAT ONE OF FOUR 1 GALLON BOTTLES HAD A CRACK IN IT. THE LEAKING BOTTLE LEAKED ON THE OTHER BOTTLES. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP.

item.description:
Report X-2025040364

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A LEAKING HAZMAT WAS DISCOVERED ON DOOR 286 ON THE NIGHT SORT. THE RESPONDER USED ALL NECESSARY PPE AND DECISION TREE WHILE RESPONDING TO THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND RETURNED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2025040076
item.description:
Report X-2025040076

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO LEAKING PACKAGE WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL NOTED THAT TWO OF FOUR 1 GALLON METAL PAILS WAS DENTED AND LEAKING. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP.
